name: Blazing Angels: Squadrons of WWII
overview:
Blazing Angels is an arcade flying game where players pilot a WWII fighter plane into combat missions from famous air battles. The coin-op version is derived from the popular UbiSoft game of the same name, and has been developed by Global VR.

The combat missions are all based on real air battles which took place during WWII, including the Battle of Britain where players fly over London defending Parliament from an attack by a Luftwaffe. Some of the other battles in the game are set over the North African desert and in the South Pacific.

The cabinet is designed to resemble the cockpit of a WWII fighter plane, with players sitting in the cockpit where they can maneuver their planes through 360 degrees turns.
